## Notation Guide

| Symbol | Description | Example/Notes |
|:-------|:------------|:--------------|
| **Data Structure** | | |
| $D_{i}$ | Data set $i$ | Individual monitoring dataset |
| $D_{ij}$ | Data set $i$, year $j$ | Data from one dataset in a specific year |
| $D_{ijk}$ | Data set $i$, year $j$, subset $k$ | Specific sample size subset (e.g., 100, 200, 300 samples) |
| $N(D_{ij})$ | Sample size | Number of samples in $D_{ij}$ |
| $\mathcal{Y}_{\text{sim}}$ | Simulated biotic data | Community occurrence/abundance matrices |
| **Environmental Data** | | |
| $X$ | Complete set of environmental variables | $X = \{X_{1}, X_{2}, ..., X_{p}\}$ |
| $p$ | Number of environmental variables | Total available predictors |
| $\mathcal{X}_{\text{org}}$ | Original environmental data | Empirical environmental conditions |
| $\mathcal{X}_{\text{sim}}$ | Simulated environmental data | Modified environmental conditions |
| $\mathcal{X}_{S}$ | Selected environmental variables | Variables used to define typology |
| $\mathcal{X}_{S^{C}}$ | Neglected environmental variables | Complement set; variables not used in typology |
| $\mathcal{X}_{\text{enz}}$ | Environmental Zone reference data | All catchments within relevant Environmental Zones |
| $S \subseteq \{1,...,p\}$ | Subset of variable indices | Randomly selected for each iteration |
| $\|S\|$ | Size of subset $S$ | Number of variables in the typology (3 to $p$) |
| **Dilation and Clustering** | | |
| $c$ | Cluster centroid | Mean position of sites in a cluster |
| $\bar{c}$ | Overall centroid | Mean position across all clusters |
| $c_{j}$ | Centroid of cluster $j$ | Position of specific cluster center |
| $c_{j}^{*}$ | Modified centroid | After separation dilation |
| $\gamma_{s}$ | Separation dilation factor | $\sim U(0, 0.25)$; moves centroids apart/together |
| $\gamma_{c}$ | Compactness dilation factor | $\sim U(-0.5, 0.5)$; adjusts within-cluster spread |
| $\Gamma$ | Dilation score combination | $\Gamma = (\gamma_{s}, \gamma_{c})$ |
| $d_{i}^{*}$ | Modified distance | Distance from site to modified centroid |
| **Iteration and Indexing** | | |
| $i$ | Site index | Individual sampling location ($i = 1, ..., N$) |
| $j$ | Cluster/type index | Individual cluster or type ($j = 1, ..., T$) |
| $k$ | Subset index | Index for sample size subsets |
| $o$ | Iteration index | Simulation iteration ($o = 1, ..., m$) |
| $m$ | Number of iterations | Total simulation iterations (target: 200) |
| $h$ | Taxon index | Individual species ($h = 1, ..., H$) |
| $H$ | Number of taxa | Total species richness |
| $N$ | Total number of sites | Across all types |

**Note on subscript hierarchy:** Single subscripts denote specific instances (e.g., $D_{i}$ = dataset $i$), double subscripts add temporal detail (e.g., $D_{ij}$ = dataset $i$ in year $j$), and triple subscripts add further subdivision (e.g., $D_{ijk}$ = dataset $i$, year $j$, subset $k$). Superscripts denote modifications (e.g., $c^{*}$) or complements (e.g., $S^{C}$).
